Tuna, a new #MemeCoin   launchpad on #Solana  , has launched with a bonding-curve model and built-in exit protection aimed at reducing early rug-pull losses.  Tokens launched on Tuna enter a 60-minute protected phase, where pricing is determined solely by a bonding curve rather than open-market trading.  During this window, buyers can exit at zero loss (excluding gas fees), receiving their original principal back if they sell.  After the protection period ends, tokens transition to normal market trading.  The #Launchpad   is separate from the DeFiTuna protocol ( #TUNA   ), despite sharing branding.  The model aims to curb panic selling and improve fairness in $SOL  's fast-moving memecoin ecosystem.  #Altcoin Season#    You can have follow us on our X account to Build a strong Community across all our channels:     x.com/Cryptofeed_N

I probably shouldn‚Äôt be saying this ü§ê  But I found a gold mine on Solana.  Tokens like $SOL  and $WIF  see massive daily liquidity flows, and there‚Äôs a way to earn off trader activity with far less stress than trading itself.  Most people would gatekeep this.  I won‚Äôt.  When markets turn red, traders panic.  But liquidity providers get paid by that panic and chop.   Using DLMMs (Dynamic Liquidity Market Makers) on Meteora, you can deploy liquidity within specific price ranges and earn fees from every trade that happens inside them.  The real alpha isn‚Äôt predicting direction. It‚Äôs monetizing volume. As long as people trade, fees flow. This is why the Meteora LP community has already earned $1.2B+ in rewards, but quietly.  No hype.  No prediction.  I‚Äôd usually keep this to myself. But someone has to say it.  Stop fading this Solana liquidity gold rush üß†  #DeFi

Global crypto theft hit $3.4 billion.

North Korea alone captured $2.02B, nearly 60% of the total loot.

We‚Äôve analyzed the 2025 illicit flow data, and the signal is terrifying. üßµ 
2/9 First, the big picture. 

Between Jan and Dec 2025, over $3.4 BILLION was stolen across the industry.

Nearly half of that came from a single event. 

The massive Bybit compromise in February alone accounted for $1.5 billion. 
3/9 The "Bybit Effect" skewed the data, and exposed the perpetrator. 
 
The DPRK (North Korea) 

They stole at least $2.02 billion in 2025, a 51% increase from 2024.  

That brings their all-time crypto heist total to a mind-blowing $6.75 billion. 
4/9 DPRK‚Äôs operations is no more smash-and-grab. 

They're playing the long game.  

Embedding IT workers inside crypto services, exchanges, custodians, web3 firms.

They get hired, get privileged access, and then... they drain the vaults.
5/9 We also got a look at their laundering playbook. 

It‚Äôs distinct.

While other hackers move funds in big chunks ($1M-$10M)

DPRK prefers smaller tranches (under $500k) to stay under the radar.

They heavily rely on Chinese-language guarantee services and cross-chain bridges. 
6/9 The laundering timeline is a 45-day "wash cycle"

Days 0-5: Immediate layering via DeFi & Mixers.
Days 6-10: Moving to exchanges with weak KYC.
Days 20-45: Cashing out via OTCs & specialized services. 

But, personal wallet compromises tripled to 158,000 incidents in 2025. 
7/9 Which chains are the most prone to attacks? 

‚Ä¢ Ethereum & Tron have the highest theft rates per 100k wallets.

Surprisingly, Base and Solana showed lower victimization rates relative to their massive user bases.  

However, DeFi is actually getting safer.

Proof: 
8/9 Venus Protocol incident in September.

Attackers compromised a Zoom client to hijack a $13M account.

But Venus had onboarded @Hexagate_ just a month prior. 

They detected it, paused the protocol, and saved the funds. 

Also, the attacker lost $3M of its own assets.
9/9 But let's not get complacent.

The DPRK executed 74% fewer known attacks in 2025 but stole more money.

They are becoming:
‚Ä¢ Patient
‚Ä¢ Sophisticated
‚Ä¢ and devastatingly effective.

As we head into 2026, the industry has to adapt. 

DPRK isn't stopping. Neither should we. 
Read the full analysis on Cryptopolitan.

https://www.cryptopolitan.com/north-korean-hackers-steal-2-02-billion-2025/

Stay safe out there.

Over the past 24 hours,
trading volumes for BTC, ETH, and SOL have all dropped by more than 50%.

This is less about price action
and more a sign that overall market participation has sharply declined.

When volume dries up,
price action tends to become unstable,
and even small trades can move the market disproportionately.

This is not a market to be aggressive.
It‚Äôs a phase to wait for liquidity to return.
$SOL  just saw two random lines cross on a chart, $300 by Christmas

According to Glassnode,
on a 90-day moving average basis, stablecoins have become the primary drivers of on-chain value transfer.
‚Ä¢  USDC: ~$124B
‚Ä¢  USDT: ~$68B
Meanwhile, transfers of native assets are relatively subdued:
‚Ä¢  BTC: ~$81B
‚Ä¢  ETH: ~$7.9B
‚Ä¢  SOL: ~$9.6B
This suggests that the current on-chain environment is less about price speculation
and more about using stablecoins as liquidity rails.
The key question now is where this capital flows next.

The surge in $SOL   ETF inflows since early December speaks volumes about market sentiment. But inflows alone don't guarantee sustainability; it's the underlying project fundamentals that will truly determine long-term viability. Numbers can be deceiving. Ôªø#SOL

üìä„ÄêXWIN TREND INDEXÔΩúDecember 21, 2025„Äë
Overall Score: 33 / 100
‚Ä¢ 80‚Äì100 = Strong Uptrend
‚Ä¢ 60‚Äì79 = Mild Uptrend
‚Ä¢ 40‚Äì59 = Neutral / No Clear Direction
‚Ä¢ 20‚Äì39 = Mild Downtrend
‚Ä¢ 0‚Äì19 = Strong Downtrend
Direction: ‚ÄúMild Downtrend.‚Äù
One-liner: Participation and flows remain thin. Weekend moves are mostly noise; the real test comes as liquidity returns after Monday.
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Market Summary
 „ÉªBTC continues to trade in a thin order book typical of weekends, making prices sensitive to small trades
 „ÉªETH also remains fragile on short-term supply‚Äìdemand dynamics; bounces lack convincing volume
 „ÉªTrading volumes for BTC, ETH, and SOL have dropped sharply, making reduced participation the dominant theme rather than price itself
 „ÉªETF flows remain heavy, acting as a short-term cap on upside momentum
 „ÉªWeekends tend to be a period for position adjustment, not trend formation; clearer direction usually appears with weekday liquidity
 „ÉªThe CME gap around 87,837 remains influential; after being filled, price can be drawn toward the next liquidation clusters above
 „ÉªThe 90,000‚Äì91,000 zone is a key inflection area; without strong flows, breakouts are prone to failure and retests
 „ÉªConclusion: Range-bound volatility persists, but this is a ‚Äúwait‚Äù market rather than one to press risk
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
On-Chain & Technical Trends
 „ÉªShort-term holder (STH) momentum remains negative, reflecting risk-off behavior and position adjustment rather than fundamental deterioration
 „ÉªPast strong rallies (74k ‚Üí 108k ‚Üí 126k) all coincided with STHs shifting into profit-expansion mode, making the momentum flip the key signal to watch
 „ÉªClaims that long-term holders are aggressively selling should be treated cautiously, as exchange-related UTXO updates can distort holding-period metrics
 „ÉªPriority framework: price < exchange/ETF flows < OI and funding < liquidation spikes, which often dictate short-term direction
 „ÉªLiquidity dispersion across DEX perpetuals increases the risk of localized thin books and sudden price jumps
 „ÉªETH frequently revisits the realized price of accumulation addresses; continued holding or adding by these cohorts suggests downside resilience
 „ÉªRange reference: resistance at 90,000‚Äì91,000, support near 85,000; whether support holds defines a war-of-attrition versus renewed downside
 „ÉªStrategy: minimal leverage, scaled entries, and limit orders; validate rebounds through volume and flows
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Sentiment
 „ÉªFear & Greed remains in ‚ÄúFear‚Äù territory, a condition that often produces wicks and two-sided stop-hunts
 „ÉªA deeply negative Coinbase premium signals strong short-term selling by U.S. participants; historically, extremes can precede seller exhaustion
 „ÉªCooling social and search interest reflects retail stepping back rather than outright bearishness; major moves often follow periods of apathy
 „ÉªThe more skewed shorts become, the stronger upside acceleration can be‚Äîbut without flows, squeezes tend to fade quickly
 „ÉªWeekends reward patience; sentiment often shifts once weekday liquidity returns
 „ÉªStrong demand for tail-risk hedges can coexist with sudden squeeze rallies, reinforcing the need for position sizing discipline
 „ÉªCore theme: pessimism spreads easily, but the market structure is not broken
 „ÉªConclusion: focus on positioning and liquidation dynamics, not emotions
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
U.S. Traditional Markets
 „ÉªDespite the BOJ rate hike, the yen remains weak, keeping FX volatility elevated and influencing global risk assets
 „ÉªUnwinding of yen carry trades can compress leverage globally, making crypto less likely to trade independently
 „ÉªU.S. rates and options-related positioning are likely to dominate post-event price action, spilling over into crypto markets
 „ÉªETF behavior often diverges from price, reflecting longer-term positioning rather than short-term trading signals
 „ÉªFlows into safe-haven assets encourage selection rather than broad rallies within crypto
 „ÉªRegulatory and structural progress supports the medium term, but short-term price action remains driven by supply‚Äìdemand and liquidations
 „ÉªConclusion: monitor rates, FX, and options alongside crypto
 „ÉªMacro watch: sharp USD/JPY moves tend to trigger risk-off reactions, favoring lighter positioning
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Overall Assessment
With weekend liquidity thin, declining volumes and persistent negative STH momentum push the score to 33, indicating a mild downtrend. Prices may appear stable, but rebounds without participation and flows are fragile. The 90,000‚Äì91,000 area will test the quality of any recovery.
Key points today:
1. Whether ETF outflows stabilize for BTC and ETH
2. OI, funding, and liquidation behavior‚Äîdo two-sided whipsaws subside?
3. The return of weekday volume and any inflection in STH momentum, which would quickly change the market‚Äôs tone.

Poain‚Äôs Stablecoin Staking Model Amid Solana Price Volatility

#Macro Insights#

The BoJ raised the uncollateralized overnight call rate from 0.5% to around 0.75%, adjusting the degree of monetary accommodation. The central bank said the move reflects greater confidence that price and wage developments are evolving broadly in line with its projections. The decision aligns with expectations that the BoJ was preparing to take another step away from ultra-loose policy.  Investors responded positively to the decision, with Bitcoin advancing about 3% following the announcement. Ether ( $ETH  ) jumped about 4% while Solana ( $SOL  ) pushed even higher by 12:00 UTC.  Japanese government bond yields moved higher following the decision, with the 30-year yield near 3.4%, close to recent highs. The yen weakened modestly, with USD/JPY rising to near 156.0, suggesting the move was largely anticipated. Crypto markets have remained under pressure, with Bitcoin and Ether still in negative territory for the week, amid weak risk sentiment.
